Arcillera
Municipality
Arcillera
Location in Spain
Coordinates: 41°41′58.85″N 6°20′52.66″W﻿ / ﻿41.6996806°N 6.3479611°W﻿ / 41.6996806; -6.3479611

 • Summer (DST) UTC+2 (CEST)
Postal code 49511

Arcillera is a small village in the province of Zamora, Spain, close to the border with Portugal.

A Celtic hoard of silver jewellery and denarii dating to approximately 20 BC was found in Arcillera in the early twentieth century. It is now mostly preserved in the collections of the British Museum.[1]

See also[edit]

  • Cordoba Treasure for similar Celtic hoard

References[edit]

  1. ^ British Museum Collection
